metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29909 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Documents in deeply-nested cross-origin browsing contexts could have obtained permissions granted to the top-level origin, bypassing the existing prompt and wrongfully inheriting the top-level permissions. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox < 100.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
